comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content:
Typical "Tyneside Flats" with front and rear views in one photo.
On the right of the photo the two front doors are together.
The right door was for the ground-floor flat.
The left door was for the staircase to the upper flat.
In Stanley, County Durham some designs had 4 front doors grouped together.

In the centre of the photo is the rear view with an open staircase leading to the upper flat.
Imagine coming down that staircase in the dark winter to visit the outside toilet.
Each small back yard had its own back gate and coal house.
There were chimney stacks for the living room and kitchen coal fires.
